intro: Thoa venosa, commonly known as the veined thoa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a pale yellow to greenish hue. Thoa venosa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
